job_offers.description: Inline is looking for a full stack engineer with a career interest in front-end development. The person in this role will focus on building and refining new and existing web applications that generate peak loads of 50k+ API requests per second in application stack running at 99.99%+ availability. You will be helping tens of thousands of restaurant staff get their work done, and ensuring each restaurant gets value from using the Inline services. Specific requirements: General requirements: Experience working in a small team and taking ideas from design Iterating towards greatness across multiple releases is something you enjoy. You value test coverage, automation, and clear documentation. Role can be based in NYC, or remote. Relocation is available. Tech you should know: Front-end: Javascript, React, Redux, HTML, CSS, SASS Back-end: NodeJS, Express, RESTful APIs Databases: PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, Firebase Realtime Database Servers: Kubernetes, GCP, AWS Tools/Misc.: git, unit testing, automated deploys Services we use: GitHub, CircleCI, Slack, Asana, Mixpanel, Kibana Apply here, or by sending a note to Why work at inline:

job_offers.job_title: Backend Software Engineer at Mission Driven FinTech
job_offers.description: We are looking for a Software Engineer to join our small but growing engineering team to scale our consumer-facing product! You will work closely with Product, Operations, Customer Support and other functions to build out a reliable, performant, and secure platform for handling remittances across countries. As an early member of the team, we hope you will also have a lot of impact on our team culture, processes and norms. Taptap Send is a cross-platform mobile app developed with React Native and Flow, which talks to a backend service written in Kotlin and backed by a PostgreSQL database, all of which runs on AWS and is managed via Terraform and Ansible. This is a backend-focused role, but you will have plenty of opportunities to work on all parts of our tech stack. We’re excited to grow the team in order to tackle our challenges, which include scaling up to handle increased volume, improving UI and UX to drive growth and retention, handling increasingly sophisticated fraud attacks, building internal tools for our customer support and acquisition efforts, and much more. You are Requirements Nice to have but not required

You will be responsible for leading development of Macabacus' next generation of transformational productivity and software. These products will supplement our current product lineup, which includes the enterprise solutions available for Microsoft Office. Our existing products are deployed in Fortune global investment banks, private equity firms, consulting firms, sovereign wealth funds, and other institutions around the world. You will design, build, and maintain the logic and data structures behind our newest products, designing easy-to-use APIs and tools that will be used by other developers. In addition, you will seek to continually improve code quality through testing and continuous integration. Having experience with Python and Django is preferred, but experience with a mainstream language and framework is required. Experience with RESTful architecture, and with RDBMS and/or NoSQL databases is required. Salary and job title will with experience in the technologies above.

job_offers.job_title: Staff Software Engineer - Pricing at Root Insurance (a $6B valuation startup)
job_offers.description: The engineering team at Root strives to be one of the most transformative engineering teams ever. We’re changing the way that car insurance works. that have been around for a century a $200B industry—and we’re doing it with an astonishingly small team. Our tech stack includes: Ruby / Rails backend, RSpec for testing Javascript / React Native frontend, Mocha for testingSmall amounts of native iOS and Android Deployment to AWS ECS using containers Buildkite for CI We've raised the largest VC round ever for an Ohio and most recently launched our IPO Our team excels at delivering software to build Root’s products: presently, mobile apps and a backend platform for personal auto insurance. We’ve shaped our team and our way of working around this. Our engineering team would not be the most transformative team at building a mobile operating system. We’d be quite bad at that. We’re exceptionally good at building the type of software that is necessary to invoke change in the insurance industry. For more information on engineering at Root see In this role, you would help design and build the next-generation of our pricing data infrastructure. Staff Engineers at Root are our most trusted technical experts and work across multiple teams of engineers to set and coordinate technical direction. Staff Engineers facilitate the delivery of large projects and features by helping design solutions, pair programming with other engineers, contributing to code review, and writing code themselves. They help strengthen the technical prowess of the entire by mentoring and growing the engineers around them. We divide the areas of responsibility for engineers into three major areas: Technical: The skills and knowledge that make up an engineer’s basic problem-solving toolbox. Planning and Execution: The ability to plan and execute assigned work beyond basic technical solutions.Working with Others: The ability to work effectively with other engineers and people in other functions. Scope of Impact Team/Initiative/Company What we look for in Staff Software Engineers: Technical Skills Planning and Execution Working with Others

GENERAL SUMMARY/BASIC PURPOSE OF JOB: A hands-on expert responsible for architecting, building, deploying, operating, and optimizing digital prodect Salesforce for Sinai Health System to enable efficient and effective delivery of reliable, cost-effective healthcare services and high quality experiences for patients, partners, providers and caregivers. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES: MINIMUM EDUCATION: MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS

Web Software Engineer Intern (Summer ) Our voice technology is cool, but it’s mostly invisible. That’s why we take great care in surrounding our voice applications with elegant and intuitive web-based applications to make them tangible and usable. Vail’s web development team develops user applications that enable our clients to achieve optimal benefits from our software. Creating intuitively usable web applications is a multi-disciplinary process that requires instinct, creativity, empathy and an eye for detail. We assemble collaborative teams made up of industry experts and neophytes applying principles of application design, graphic art and even cognitive psychology to ensure that we approach problems from every angle. We’d like to add a Web Software Engineer to our team, and we’d like to know if you think you fit the bill. You will if you: What you can expect to be doing: As part of the team, you’ll be expected to coordinate with internal product teams to design and develop intuitive applications using state-of-the-art technologies. Your work will be the main thing that our Fortune 500 clients and consumer users see when they interact with Vail’s technologies. You’ll work in small teams out of our office in the Chicago Loop, developing applications using Ruby on Rails, JavaScript Frameworks, APIs and maybe some other technologies that your expertise or curiosity helps bring to the table. We encourage you to consistently experiment with new technologies in order to tackle problem from multiple angles. You’ll design, code, debate, learn, and share; you’ll work hard, but you’ll have fun every day. To be considered for this position, you must: Ideally, you will also be able to demonstrate:

job_offers.job_title: Senior Full Stack Java Software Engineer with React
job_offers.description: The Spread eTrading Technology team is focused on delivering best in class IT solutions to the Credit and SPG Trading businesses where JP Morgan is a market leader. We are a team of around 30 people with the core of our development effort based in London, New York and Hong Kong where we partner closely with the quant research group and face off directly to the trading desks. Our core strength is providing technical expertise and software development skills that directly affect the ability of our business to generate revenue and remain the dominant player in the market. We to hiring the brightest and best technical experts and in return can offer roles with direct trading and quant interaction on projects related to electronic and algorithmic trading.This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:  Expertise in application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines  Advanced knowledge of architecture, design and business processes  Proficiency in multiple modern programming languages  Knowledge of industry wide technology strategies and best practices  Ability to work in large, collaborative teams to goals, and passionate about building an innovative culture  10+ years of development experience with primary focus in Java; Python, React, JavaScript and C++ experience desired  Ideal candidate has experience with design and development in a multi-tier messaging based architecture. Experience should include building low latency, high throughput, scalable, fault-tolerant systems.  Strong grasp of object oriented design and programming principles, multi-threaded architecture  Experience with middleware technologies (e.g. RMDS, Informatica UM, Chronicle, AMPS, Tibco).  Experience with JavaScript and React highly preferred  An understanding of virtual machine architecture including memory management, garbage collection and is a plus. Understanding of financial markets along with experience in electronic trading preferred  Strong database skills and experience with SQL, noSQL databases  Continuous deployment skills: Jenkins, Chef, Bamboo  Containerization with Docker and Kubernetes  Experience with SCM tools: Spring, Maven, Git.  line and shell Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Work directly with America's best employers to bring joy to millions of employees! Note: At PerkSpot, the safety and wellness of our employees is our top priority. To provide our employees with the support they may need to maintain their personal health and wellness, our office is open and available for those employees who are interested in using it. Our long term goal is for PerkSpot employees to return to our Chicago office, however working remotely will be an option until everyone and it is 100% safe for all to return. Hi, to PerkSpot. We’re looking for multiple strategic and analytical Software Engineers to join our growing tech team and impact some of the largest employers in America. Our tech is at the forefront of what we do here at PerkSpot. As a Software Engineer, you will work with the engineering team to improve the technical functions of our application data-centric back-end development. You’ll work along-side others in developing design solutions for individual business needs and requirements, while identifying and resolving bugs and code defects. Your work will serve to improve the usability and effectiveness of the tool for all users. About PerkSpot PerkSpot is an employee that works with America’s top employers to offer exclusive discounts, rewards, and recognition to millions of employees. These exclusive perks and savings are a great recruitment and retention tool that allows employees to take advantage of unique opportunities and feel great about they work for. We help employees from over like Spotify, Walgreens, McDonald's, and Lyft save on everything from gym memberships and movie tickets to electronics, new cars, and travel. Profitable and growing, was founded in  by good people with a great vision, and we’re carrying on the work they started. In , was proud to announce an additional investment of $50 million dollars from Susquehanna Growth Equity. As we continue to grow, we’re excited about our leadership position in the industry, but we’re to doing more - developing better products, reaching more employers, and getting more employees engaged with our platform. Our passion is to make every place a great place to work, starting with our own. We’re a big platform, but a small team. That means we’re going to trust you with more responsibility than you’d have anywhere else and invest in your success and growth more than any other employer. Meet the Technology Team PerkSpot’s Technology team is made up of Software Engineers, QA Analysts, and DevOps Engineers with one goal in mind - to keep PerkSpot moving and improving. We work collaboratively to optimize our application, making it work as efficiently and user-friendly as possible. Because of our fast-moving, project-based structure, the team allows for significant opportunities for learning, growth, and diversity of work - you’ll certainly never get bored here. Our work directly impacts the PerkSpot platform, and therefore our partners and their hardworking employees as well. Life as a Software Engineer: What we’re looking for: What will REALLY help you stick out: Your First Few Months: As a member of the Tech team, you will undergo training to familiarize yourself with the entire software engineering process, including QA and DevOps. Under the direction of a Senior Engineer and other team members, you will learn the basics of the PerkSpot platform, Git repositories, Azure environments, etc. You will then be expected to assist with various high-priority projects, eventually establishing a minimum of ten story points per week of tasks. You will also help incorporate advanced technology into the PerkSpot platform for the betterment of its users while a collaborative contributing member of our robust team. The Perks of Working at PerkSpot We’re a big platform, but still a small team. That means we’re going to trust you with more responsibility than elsewhere, and invest in you more. You’re going to grow – a lot. We work out of our office in Chicago’s River North neighborhood. When we are in the office, we dress how we like, encourage flexible hours and an open time-off policy, stock a good beer selection, and we’re pretty obsessive about our coffee. Most of all, we good people with lots of energy and enthusiasm. PerkSpot offers the full suite of benefits you’d expect from a profitable, including health and dental insurance, a generous parental leave policy, 401(k), pre-tax transit benefits, and fully-funded disability coverage. We have in-office bike storage, a private gym, and a shower on-site. We hold get-togethers where we learn from what went wrong and celebrate what went right. Every week at PerkSpot, we aim a little higher and get a little bit better than the previous week. Because we consider every member of our team to be a fundamental part of our success, we encourage everyone to be invested in our success, regardless of their position. We want every one of our employees to think like an owner, by putting in the effort to exceed expectations, solve problems before up, and always go the extra mile. It’s this drive to succeed that makes PerkSpot such an interactive and fulfilling place to work. How to Apply All applications will be kept strictly confidential. Please submit a resume AND cover letter (we know it is old school, but a cover letter is very important to us) telling us how you stack up to the qualifications, plus any other information you feel would be relevant to PerkSpot. Don’t be afraid to show your spark and personality! All positions require a full background screening.

GENERAL SUMMARY/BASIC PURPOSE OF JOB: Caregiver's primary role is to design, develop and implement high-quality, dynamic solutions to various internal and external clients throughout the health system. He/she will use development tools and programing languages to design and code technical solutions that meet the needs of the business. This role will follow specific coding and release management standards, work along side DBAs and other programmers to design optimized and efficient logical databases for use within sharepoint and leverage industry best practices for security, customizations and governance relative to the Sharepoint technology stack. ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES Assists in planning and documentation of projects related to the development and maintenance of SharePoint environments. In collaboration with other team members, assists in the overall management of the SharePoint environment from both an operational perspective and an end-user perspective. Develops documentation, validates, and monitors that operational policies are being met. Creates documentation, and assists in the planning aspects of future enhancements. Assists in the development and implementation of site layouts, site templates, user navigation strategies, and information/data management strategies. Technical solution lead architecting topology and scalability of farm, solutions and tenant. Designs, develops, tests, debugs, and deploys web parts, event receivers, and workflows for Sandboxed or Farm level solutions. Configures BCS Services, custom content types, SharePoint security and permissions, SharePoint API and Client Object Model. Designs, develops and implements custom branding solutions for SharePoint including, Master Pages, Layout Pages, CSS, jQuery and jQuery Designs and implement program logic, specifications, flow charts and supporting process diagrams for business software specifications. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS: 1.Several years of relevant SharePoint development experience2.Several years of proven experience with design, planning, and implementation in SharePoint Portal and SharePoint Services /.3.Experience of Web Development technologies including ASP.NET, C#, AJAX, JQUERY, HTML5, CSS and SQL Server (AngularJS a plus).4. Experience with SharePoint Designer, InfoPath, Visual Studio, Team Site setup and configuration, Dashboards, and Web Parts.5. In-depth understanding of the SharePoint development lifecycle in support of multiple user groups.6. Technical back-end knowledge of SharePoint's system design and architecture, development, testing, deployment and maintenance.7. Database proficiencies in SQL, Excel, DB, and XML.8. Experience creating, modifying, and supporting web based platforms and solutions.9. Experience with SharePoint site administration and web part configuration.10.Ability to issues in the SharePoint environment .11.Understanding of SharePoint web content management and search engine optimization.12. Proven in-depth understanding of the capabilities of SharePoint, SharePoint templates (site and lists templates), web parts development, workflow and content management.13.Knowledge of LDAP/Active Directory authentication and group security as they apply to SharePoint.14.Strong understanding of SharePoint Farm architectures, Office 365 and software as a service solutions.15.Strong knowledge of Windows architecture including Windows / server design and support as they related to SharePoint. 16. Ability to design, code, and unit test applications based on .Net, Web Services, SQL, JavaScript - JQuery - Datatables JQuery Library - CSS - SharePoint JavaScript Client Side Object Model - SPServices - AJAX Calls into the SharePoint  REST Interface using JQuery. 17.Excellent documentation and analytical skills. 18.Strong customer interaction skills including verbal and skills are essential. MINIMUM WORK EXPERIENCE: • With B.S. Degree - 5 years of relevant experience including leading projects. • Without B.S. degree - 8 years of relevant experience including leading projects and developing teams. REQUIRED LICENSES, CERTIFICATES, REGISTRATIONS: MCSE or equivalent is strongly desired but not required

Your impact. We are looking for an ambitious senior engineer with a deep desire to learn and develop software that improves people’s lives. If you’re passionate about developing the best software and collaborating with other developers to do so, then we want to hear from you! You will enhance our SaaS solution, scale highly distributed systems, and continuously improve our engineering practices. You will get to work on the latest software practices and technologies such as microservices architecture, cloud design patterns, automated CI/CD pipeline, automated and orchestrated Dockerized delivery, and AWS platform. Above all, your work will impact people’s interactions with the healthcare system. Your experience. Our rewards. Work should be meaningful and rewarding. HealthJoy offers a robust package of employee perks and benefits including healthcare benefits, flexible PTO plan, 401k, benefits, parental leave, and HSA contribution match. We also enjoy each over wellness activities, catered Friday lunches, happy hours, volunteer events in our lunch and learns, and ‘friendship time’ pairings. The best benefit of all? We use our own product. As an employee, you can rely on HealthJoy to feel confident about your own healthcare decisions and get the most out of your unique benefits plan. HealthJoy to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or any other basis forbidden under federal, state, or local law.

The Data Engineer will work on collecting, storing, processing, and analyzing huge sets of data. The primary focus will be on choosing optimal solutions to use for these purposes, then maintaining, implementing, and monitoring them. You will also be responsible for integrating them with the architecture used across Because we work on the cutting edge of a lot of technologies, this job requires a creative problem solver, resourced in getting things done, and productive working independently or collaboratively. Duties and Responsibilities Description • Data - Analysis, Modeling, Architecture, etc. - Completes work with some independence and some guidance from senior members of the team. Gather and process raw data at scale. . Work closely with our data science team (ad hoc analysis of the data). Acquire data from primary or secondary sources and maintain databases/systems. Create data sets and tables to store data. Make and test database schema changes when needed. Identify user needs to create and administer the data lake. Ingest and move data between databases that includes relational and no-SQL databases like Oracle, SQL Server, MongoDB, Elastic Search, Google Bigquery etc.Implement security measures by encrypting sensitive data • ETL Development - Completes work with some independence and some guidance from senior members of the team. Build and implement ETL processes. Modify ETL jobs to improve performance and efficiency • Support: Troubleshoot problems Education Background 4 Year / Bachelor's Degree Work Experience Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities • Leadership  Competencies

job_offers.job_title: Senior Solutions Architect - Media & Entertainment (flexible location in Germany)
job_offers.description: This role is within the and you would be working with Media & Entertainment enterprise customersSolutions Architects work hand in hand with AWS customers to help them make the most of the Cloud. They are at the crossroads of business and technology and engage at all stages of cloud adoption. Solutions Architects are responsible for creating and presenting technical content and sharing best practices.Solutions Architects are responsible for the overall technical relationship between customers and AWS and make on security, cost, performance, reliability and operational efficiency. They work to understand the customer's needs and give prescriptive guidance on how to create business value with AWS technology. Solutions Architects lead activities such as architecture reviews, white-boarding sessions, demos and technical workshops. They collaborate with other teams such as account management, professional services, support, product teams and the AWS partner ecosystem.In this role you will get to practice your creativity, linking technology to tangible solutions and educating AWS customers about the art of the possible. You will have the opportunity to define or invent cloud-native reference architectures for a variety of use cases. The Solutions Architecture team is a diverse group of technologists from a variety of backgrounds. Practical knowledge of the AWS platform is desired but not required, provided you have a sound technical foundation and a desire to learn.You will have the support to grow your expertise in industry and technology areas of depth. Every day you will learn something new from your customers, your peers and your own experiments.At Amazon you will be encouraged and rewarded for doing what is right for the long-term success of the customer. We value your passion to discover, invent and build on behalf of customers.Amazon has always been, and always will to diversity and inclusion. We seek builders from all backgrounds to join our teams, and we encourage our employees to bring their authentic, original, and best selves to work.Role and Responsibilities:· Work directly with strategic customers to accelerate their challenging, mission-critical projects and best-practice architectures in line with their long-term business Build technical relationships with customers and operate as their trusted advisor. The best interests of the customer will shape the guidance you provide.· Share the voice of the customer to inform the roadmap of AWS features.· Participate in the creation and sharing of best practices, technical content and new reference architectures (e.g. white papers, code samples, blog posts).· Evangelize and educate about AWS (e.g. through workshops, user groups, meetups, public speaking, online videos or conferences).· Contribute to the growth of the Solutions by interviewing candidates and having a voice in hiring decisions. You will also be helping others develop new skills by mentoring team members· Develop areas of depth in technical domains relevant to your interests and your customer's Domestic travel up to 30%.The position is available with flexible location in Germany.

At the core of the Un-carrier’s successful disruption of the wireless industry is a nationwide 5G network, award-winning customer service, and a multifaceted group of software developers. T-Mobile’s Product & Technology is looking for experienced software engineers at all levels of experience to join our Be part of the Un-carrier Revolution and build the solutions helping to give T-Mobile customers the best customer experience in the industry while salary and benefits! Our dev practices are founded on open teamwork and collaboration between customers and development teams, with an emphasis Our newest software products are built using modern dev languages, runtimes, and frameworks such as TypeScript, Angular, React, NodeJS, Golang, and Python. We're modernizing our architectures to replace Java monoliths with resilient microservices, elegant APIs, and beautiful front ends. Some opportunities include the newest technology shaping our world, including IoT, machine learning, and augmented reality. Most importantly, P&T empowers software teams with the tools, resources, and autonomy they need to deliver amazing experiences for our customers and other employees. The engineering process is highly collaborative. Sr. Software Engineers are expected to pair on a daily basis as they work through user stories and support products as they evolve. As a Sr. Software Engineer, you will be able to operate independently, though typically will work as part of a team with varying skillsets to create, support, and deploy production applications. job_offers.job_title: Sr. Engineering Developer (Python / Go / Ruby) - Remote
job_offers.description: Sr. Engineering Developer (Python / Go / Ruby) - CTP - Atlanta, GA (100% Remote) - $60.00-$65.00/hr Hays Specialist Recruitment is working in partnership with Truist to manage the recruitment of this positionThe end client is unable to sponsor or transfer visas for this position; all parties authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply.FinTech has been experiencing aggressive growth in the IT Industry and the FinTech Capital of the World is right here in Atlanta! This industry is not slowing down and now you can be a part of it at some of the biggest players in the game. Truist will be the 6th largest bank in the country once the integration between SunTrust and BB&T. Join us to help make this happen and work with cutting edge technology! Role Description Leverage forward thinking engineering principles to realize next gen digital banking securely; we'll achieve this by building and enhancing vulnerability management and data protection capabilities Skills & Requirements  4 or more years of coding experience with modern scripting languages like Python, Go, and Ruby  4 or more years of experience with RESTful API web services and writing web APIs  4 or more years of experience with Version Control Systems (VCS), Continuous Integration (CI) systems , and build tools like GitHub, RTC, Jenkins, Bamboo, Maven, and Gradle  3 or more years experience with SQL/NoSQL and structured and non-structured data  At least one year or more with Agile framework (e.g. CI/CD)  At least one year or more developing and managing applications/databases/instances with Public Cloud services (e.g. IaaS, CaaS, PaaS, SaaS)  Exposure to Cybersecurity framework like NIST, COBIT, ISA, and ISO  Exposure to container solutions like Kubernetes and Docker

The Staff Software Engineer is responsible for joining a product team and contributing to the software design, software development, and overall product lifecycle for a product that our users love. The engineering process is highly collaborative. Staff Software Engineers are expected to pair on a daily basis as they work through user stories and support products as they evolve. Staff Software Engineers contribute to foundational code elements that can be reused as well as architectural diagrams and other product-related documentation. In addition, Staff Software Engineers may be involved in product configuration, performance tuning and testing as well as production monitoring. As a Staff Software Engineer, you will be a core player on the product team and are expected to build and grow the skillsets of the more junior Engineers.MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES 70% – Delivery & Execution: Collaborates and pairs with other product team members (UX, engineering, and product management) to create secure, reliable, scalable software solutions Documents, reviews and ensures that all quality and change control standards are met Writes custom code or scripts to automate infrastructure, monitoring services, and test cases Writes custom code or scripts to do “destructive testing” to ensure adequate resiliency in production Creates meaningful dashboards, logging, alerting, and responses to ensure that issues are captured and addressed proactively Contributes to enterprise-wide tools to drive destructive testing, automation, or engineering empowerment Identifies product enhancements (client-facing or technical) to create a better experience for the end users Identifies unsecured code areas and implements fixes as they are discovered with or without tooling Contributes to foundational code elements that can be reused many times by a product Contributes to meaningful architecture diagrams and other documentation needed for security reviews or other interested parties Defines Service Level Objectives for product(s) to constantly measure their reliability in production and help prioritize backlog work 20% – Support & Enablement: Fields questions from other product teams or support teams Monitors tools and participates in conversations to encourage collaboration across product teams Provides application support for software running in production Proactively monitors production Service Level Objectives for product(s) Proactively reviews the performance and capacity of all aspects of production: code, infrastructure, data, and message processing Triages high priority issues and outages as they arise 10% – Learning: Participates in and leads learning activities around modern software design and development core practices (communities of practice) Proactively views articles, tutorials, and videos to learn about new technologies and best practices being used within other Attends conferences and learns how to apply new technologies where appropriateNATURE AND SCOPE Typically reports to the Software Engineer Manager or Sr. Manager.ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTSEnvironment: Located in indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable.Travel: Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONSMust be eighteen years of age or older. Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. The Software Engineer Principal is responsible for joining a product team and contributing to the software design, software development, and overall product lifecycle for a product that our users love. The engineering process is highly collaborative. In addition to pairing, Software Engineer Principals field questions from other product teams and encourage cross-team collaboration. They also play an active role working with 3rd party vendors as well as the Software Engineer Principals create foundational code elements that can be reused as well as architectural diagrams and other product-related documentation. They also define service level objectives for products. In addition, Software Engineer Principals may be involved in product configuration, performance tuning and testing as well as production monitoring. As a Software Engineer Principal, you will be an extremely knowledgeable Engineer on the product team and are expected to build and grow the skillsets of the more junior engineers. There is also an expectation that the Software Engineer Principal will demonstrate expertise around modern software design and development. MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES 70% – Delivery & Execution 20% – Support & Enablement: 10% – Learning: NATURE AND SCOPE Typically reports to the Software Engineer Manager or Sr. Manager, Technology Director or Sr. Director. ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTSEnvironment: Located in indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. Travel: Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Must be eighteen years of age or older. Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. Additional Minimum Qualifications: Mastery of an object oriented programming language (preferably Java) Must be legally permitted to work in the United States Education Required: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through of a bachelor’s degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job. Years of Relevant Work Experience: 6 years Physical Requirements: Most of the time is spent sitting in position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. On rare occasions there may be a need to move or lift light articles. Preferred Qualifications: Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies:

Our customers are inundated with information from news articles, video feeds, social media and more. We’re looking to help them parse through it faster and focus on the information that’s most important that allows them to make better decisions. We're in the process of building a next-generation analysis and exploitation platform for video, audio, documents, and social media data. This platform will help users identify, discover and triage information via a UI that leverages best in class speech-to-text, machine translation, image recognition, OCR, and entity extraction services. We're looking for data engineers to develop the infrastructure and systems behind our platform. The ideal contributor should have experience building and maintaining data and ETL pipelines. They will be expected to work in a collaborative environment, able well with their teammates and customers. This is a great opportunity to work with a high-performing team in a fun environment. At BTI360, we’re passionate about building great software and developing our people. Software doesn't build itself; teams of people do. That's why our primary focus is on developing better engineers, better teammates, and better leaders. By putting people first, we give our teammates more opportunities to grow and raise the bar of the software we develop. Interested in learning more? Apply today! Required Skills/Experience: Desired Skills: BTI360 is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status, or any other protected class.

Digital Platform Services provides the building blocks for applications in the form of Managed Services, and consequently the infrastructure engineering associated with running these managed products as part of the J.P. Morgan Digital Platform. The team is hiring engineers to work across and develop solutions that enable developers to locally build and test applications based on a serverless architecture. SIMON is looking for a DevOps Engineer. In this role, you will utilize strong DevOps principles and advanced cloud capabilities to facilitate SIMON strategy of market agility and lean operating principles with a strict focus on quality to meet the ever-growing demands of our clients. We are seeking highly collaborative, creative and intellectually curious DevOps Engineers who are passionate about forming and implementing cutting-edge capabilities. Responsibilities Minimum Qualifications Preferred Qualifications

Suzy is hiring a DevOps Engineer to oversee Suzy’s growing tech stack. As the DevOps Engineer, you will oversee a robust infrastructure which processes hundreds of millions of records to support a real time market research platform. You will work closely with the Director of Engineering, SVP Product Innovation and Technology, and the engineering team to strategize and implement scalable solutions in support of the growth projections of the business. Your role is not only a technical one but also requires an ability to closely manage the finances associated with hosting and infrastructure, and the ability to articulate and outline a risk analysis as it pertains to managing the short and long term budgets around infrastructure. Suzy is an ISO ISO/IEC : Certified business, so it is critical that you have a strong adherence to process, documentation and security standards in their day-to-day activities. Suzy utilizes Microsoft Azure as a PaaS hosting provider leveraging a SQL database, Azure app services and a variety of other services within the Azure ecosystem. Suzy uses an Azure data warehouse, and a large responsibility associated with this role will be around establishing and maintaining the necessary ETL processes in order to keep this data current and reliable. In addition, Suzy relies heavily on ElasticSearch technologies for data search and querying within the platform and you will oversee the scaling and maintenance of these instances. Responsibilities: Preferred Requirements: Suzy puts the voice of your consumer at your fingertips. Whether you’re a novice or an expert researcher, our platform brings advanced tools together with the highest quality audience to deliver insights in minutes. Some of the biggest brands in the world use Suzy to deliver breakthrough products and experiences backed by data-driven decisions. Benefits: Suzy is an equal opportunity employer. We are a place for everyone, and we do our best to ensure all people feel supported and connected at work. Suzy to protecting its customers, employees, partners, and as a whole, from damaging acts that are intentional or unintentional. Effective security is a team effort involving the participation and support of every user who interacts information/data and systems. It is the responsibility of each individual to help information assets.

The group is currently seeking a DevOps Engineer to play a critical role in the success of our modernization and application migration to a unified platform. This role will work with experts across the business, AWM support teams, AWM delivery teams, internal and external technology providers to make the vision of a world class, high performance, zero friction, end-to-end software delivery model a reality. We are looking for an engineer to lead a legacy trade/application support team and help transform them to an SRE based proactive solutions team from the current reactive state. Another initiative will be to partner up and streamline end-to-end monitoring between our different internal teams using new toolsets.The successful candidate will have a proven track record in the delivery of DevOps principles focused on enhancing the user experience and delivery productivity. Candidate will be responsible to develop proactive monitoring solutions that enable observability within You will be a DevOps expert driving Agile methodology across Asset and Wealth Management.As an Application Support professional, your dedication to innovation is essential to what keeps moving and thriving. In this role, you'll oversee application issues, including troubleshooting, maintaining, identifying, escalating and resolving. You'll ensure that the production changes your team makes are made keeping best practices, lifecycle methodology and overall risk top of mind. Partnering with Infrastructure Service Support team members, you'll dig into root cause analysis, production changes, budgetary, and staffing issues. You'll also draw on your experience to manage and mentor people to drive strategic change, both within your team as well as in collaboration with team members across Chase & Co.'s global network of innovators.This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:  BS/BA degree or equivalent experience  Proven expertise in application development and support environment with more than one technology and multiple design techniques  Advanced knowledge of development toolset to design, develop, test, deploy, maintain, and improve software  Proficiency in one or more general purpose programming (Java, Python, .Net, C++, etc.)  Understanding of risk controls to departmental standards  Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to goals  Previous hands on experience in a DevOps or Build and Release Engineer role  Hands on experience with configuration management tools  Expert analytical troubleshooting skills at any level of the stack  Proficient in relational databases (SQL/Oracle)  Expertise in scripting (JavaScript, Python, PowerShell and Bash)  Proven hands-on experience deploying and custom, multi-tiered application systems in global, online operations group  Familiarity with Cloud Service providers such as AWS and Google  Familiarity with monitoring requirements and building dashboards  Deep understanding of the end to end software engineering experience (including build, test and deployment automation)  Empathy for delivery teams and a passion for improving both the productivity and experience for teams.  Expertise working in an Agile project environment and the ability to operate development discussion forums, through a deep understanding of current application development tools and techniques especially as they relate to DevOps.  A fundamental desire and focus on minimizing overhead while empowering and enabling self-managing & agile delivery  presentation and interpersonal skills are essential, as are strong diplomatic skills and the ability to manage multiple stakeholder groups. Get to Know Voice At Voice, we are on a mission to take social media back from big tech. Voice is the first social media platform that to self-govern, champions realness and respects user data. Description We are looking for a passionate Manager, DevOps to join our team in Brooklyn, New York. Our DevOps team will work collaboratively alongside development, design, UX and business units in order to identify and eliminate constraints in the product life cycle, shorten and amplify feedback loops. You will help foster a culture of collaboration and trust while working on projects that ultimately optimize the flow of value from the idea stage to the end user. As a Manager, DevOps, you will be required to be an expert in systems architecture, networking, hosting and high availability all within the cloud. Ideally this candidate will be open to not only teaching new technologies to the team but learning from existing technologies and processes as well. You will have the added responsibility of managing and helping build a team of devops engineers to assist with its core mission to drive automation and infrastructure build out. This role will involve both personal management and overbite as well as individual contribution. This is an exciting opportunity to join a thriving, well-funded startup with big ambitions. In addition to doing ground breaking work, this role will be pivotal in establishing a culture of openness, and continuous learning. We are looking for the best and brightest to take our platform to the next level. Are you that person? Let’s talk. Responsibilities - Rotating weekly on call status/support to provide support to internal users and stakeholders Qualifications

job_offers.job_title: Senior DevOps Engineer Who Doesn't Love Containers
job_offers.description: We know that headhunters are already beating down your door. We want to earn our right to work with you every single day. We’re out to solve real world scale problems, and we need your help. Simplero is a that helps coaches, authors, and speakers transform lives at scale through online courses and memberships. We’re an all-remote team of 25 trailblazers passionate about service, personal growth, and simplicity. We have helped over  customers in 30 countries make over $200M. We’re changing lives, providing livelihoods, and offer an insanely valuable service. We’re a team united by our shared values of integrity, responsibility, and exceptional service. Annual Salary Range: $70,000 to $240,000 USD Technologies we work with Ruby on Rails, Javascript, React, MariaDB, AWS, Ansible, Memcached, ElasticSearch. Technologies we want to start working with Terraform, Nomad, Consul, Vagrant, and other relevant Hashicorp tools, Svelte.js, NewRelic, IBM Watson. The job to be done We'll need your help streamlining our infrastructure configuration, taking it from Ansible to Terraform, Nomad, and other tools. We'll need to start sharding our database, and move from our current single data center in the US to multiple data centers on multiple continents with instant failover. We're excited for the challenge, and we hope you are, too. We don't plan on using containers, as we haven't seen the cost/benefit ratio be worth it. We like to keep things simple and lean. We trust you do, too. Benefits What's in it for you Other benefits What sets Simplero apart PLEASE NOTE: Hey, we know you really want to stand out and try and make an impression with Calvin, Joshua, or other members of the leadership team personally on LinkedIn or via email, but so does everyone else, and it just ends up being annoying. Work hard on your application, work with our hiring team, and you’ll be in great hands. Or, if you’d up with something unique and personal and special that impresses us and makes us smile. :)

job_offers.job_title: Head of Platform Engineering & DevOps - Security Services
job_offers.description: Job Responsibilities:○ Define & implement the engineering and DevOps strategy for Client Technology, aligning with standards defined by the Global Partner with our cloud, networking and cyber-security teams to modernize our client-facing platform and related build and deployment practices.○ Influence architecture & design decisions with the central Global representing the needs of the Securities Services Drive development efficiency through automation. Establish metrics to accurately measure and track developer productivity and areas for improvement.○ Achieve full observability of our infrastructure, transaction tracing, monitoring, alerting, metrics, events, and logs.○ Ensure infrastructure and deployment consistency across our client-facing web and API channels.○ Define and implement our testing automation strategy, eliminating the need for manual developer and QA testing. Measure and track code coverage across development activities.○ Partner with business stakeholders to standardize our client usage and performance metrics platform and related reporting.○ Promote the Infrastructure-as-Code strategy within Securities Services. Provide working demonstrations of the standard blueprints and assist teams with adoption. Report progress to senior management and key stakeholders.Qualifications:○ 15+ years object-oriented programming experience (Java, C#, Python, etc)○ Experience implementing REST and/or GraphQL-based web services at scale.○ Experience developing, operating and maintaining distributed Production systems.○ Hands-on experience with infrastructure automation and provisioning using cloud-based technology (i.e. AWS, Azure, OpenShift).○ Relevant experience with infrastructure-as-code platforms (AWS CloudFormation or similar)○ Hands-on experience with Infrastructure tooling in an enterprise setting (i.e. Terraform, Chef, Puppet, Ansible).○ Experience recruiting and leading a global development team and related project initiatives.○ Familiarity with infrastructure management, operations lifecycle concepts and related ecosystem.○ Familiarity with developing container based solutions using orchestrators such as Chase & Co., one of the oldest financial institutions, offers innovative financial solutions to millions of consumers, small businesses and many of the world's most prominent corporate, institutional and government clients under the J.P. Morgan and Chase brands. Our history spans over 200 years and today we are a leader in investment banking, consumer and small business banking, financial transaction processing and asset management.We recognize that our people are our strength and the diverse talents they bring to our global workforce are directly linked to our success. As a SIMON Backend Engineer, you will play an integral role in designing and implementing systems that power the largest platform existing today for managed-risk financial products. We are looking for engineers who can build APIs and applications that are highly performant and intuitive. Knowledge of open-source technologies, modern web standards/best practices and distributed systems are a plus. We’re looking for candidates who like working in a fast-paced environment and are passionate about writing code, sharing ideas and building elegant and efficient systems. job_offers.job_title: Sr Kubernetes + Terraform to deploy Smart building infrastructure, Full time
job_offers.description: This position is a mix of DevOps (75%), and software development (25%). On any given day you will update and test infrastructure improvements, create internal tools, enhance our CI/CD infrastructure and support new analytics deployments. We’re looking for a seasoned engineer to join a stellar team. While this is an individual contributor role, you’ll be involved in many aspects– helping evolve our existing architecture, working with teams to improve operations, and implementing new features and functionality. We’re looking for someone who has an interest in system architecture, but a passion for getting things done. Responsibilities Skills & Abilities: Education: Experience: We take care of you!

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:  Advanced knowledge of application, data and infrastructure architecture disciplines  Understanding of architecture and design across all systems  Working proficiency in developmental toolsets  Ability to collaborate with high-performing teams and individuals throughout the firm to goals  Proficiency in one or more general purpose programming languages  Understanding of software skills such as business analysis, development, maintenance and software improvemenCorporate TechnologyOur Corporate Technology team relies on smart, driven people like you to develop applications and provide tech support for all our corporate functions across our network. Your efforts will touch lives all over the financial spectrum and across all our divisions: Global Finance, Corporate Treasury, Risk Management, Human Resources, Compliance, Legal, and within the Corporate Administrative Office. You'll be part of a team specifically built to meet and exceed our evolving technology needs, as well as our technology controls agenda.Tech at JPMCWhen you work at Chase & Co., you're not just working at a global financial institution. You're an integral part of one of the world's biggest In 14 technology hubs worldwide, our team of 40,000+ technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our$9.5B+ annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that will not only transform the financial services industry, but also change the world.Key Responsibilities  Design and Development of key functionality within the application  Carry out design reviews/code reviews at agreed points throughout the project life cycle  Work closely with the vendor development team to monitor the design/development undertaken by them  Hands on design and development of technical artifacts  Participate in technical reviews, define/Improve processes on configuration management, deployment and resiliency planning for the application.QualificationsCompetencies:Essential:  Strong Java, J2EE development experience.  Exposure to UI development  Strong technical development experience on effectively writing code, code reviews, best practices on configuration management and code refactoring.  Proficiency in SQL and Database development.  J2EE & OO Design Patterns  Proven problem solving and analytical skills  A delivery focused approach to work and the ability to work without directionDesirable:  HTML5 / Angular JS Development skills  Exposure to Rules Engine, preferably Drools  Exposure to BPM tools, preferably JBPM  Experience or knowledge of client reference data as it relates to a Global Bank would be an advantage  Experience in Agile development techniques like Scrum and Test Driven development  Exposure to Git, maven, concordian/fitnesse, crucible, sonar and JIRA desirableEssential Experience:  4 - 8 years work experience  2-4 year experience within an investment-banking environment, preferably within the Client information space  Exposure to technology development projects and the full technology development lifecycle  Excellent Communication and Inter-personal skills, both with business customers and with fellow IT professionals (Business Analysts, Project Managers and Developers).  Strong problem-solving skills  A delivery focused approach to work and the ability to work without direction  Ability to multi-task.  Ability to work to deadlines.Closing Statement  At Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we're building a that thrives on diversity. Your responsibilities Who you'll work with You will be part of a global Data and you will work in cross-functional and Agile project teams alongside Project Managers, Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers, other Data Engineers, and industry experts. You will work hands in hands with our clients, from data owners and users to C-level executives. Who you are You are a highly collaborative individual and enjoy solving problems that focus on adding business value. You have a sense of ownership and enjoy hands-on technical work. Our values resonate with yours. Your qualifications Our tech stack While we advocate for using the right tech for the right task, we often leverage the following technologies: Python, PySpark, SQL, Airflow, Databricks, our own OSS called Kedro, container technologies such as Docker and Kubernetes, cloud solutions such as AWS, GCP or Azure, and more!

The Banking Production Management team with J.P. Morgan's Corporate & Investment Bank is a global leader in Banking. The team is responsible for the reliability and resiliency of the Banking application stack within J.P. Morgan. The J.P. Morgan Banking business, consisting of Investment Banking, Treasury Services and Corporate Banking, is one of the largest wholesale banking client franchises in the world. We serve clients, including corporations, governments, states, municipalities, education institutions, banks and investors. The team interacts directly with Business Operations, Product and Client Services plus our partners in Application Development and Global Infrastructure teams. Banking applications securely process trillions of payments every day along with providing real time Liquidity and Accounting functions. We also focus on automation and tooling, to eliminate unnecessary manual effort and to enhance our monitoring capabilities.Who are we hiring?We are looking for an outstanding Application/Infrastructure Support Engineer with experience working in a fast paced, high pressured environment, ideally within financial services or a large-scale technology firm.• BS/BA degree or equivalent experience• Basic knowledge of application development• Working knowledge in one or more general purpose programming languages, plus an interest in learning other coding languages and skills as needed• Working knowledge of Financial services, ideally payment processing• Understand incredibly demanding nature of financial services, or eager to experience it• Have a thirst for knowledge and want to expand your technical and business knowledge• Experienced in one of Web/ SOA / Messaging Tools middleware technologies such as webMethods, WebSphere, Mulesoft, Apache/Tomcat• Proficient working with a variety of platforms, including UNIX/Linux• Proficient understanding of network technologies and have an interest in payment processing, trading and accounting systems• Experienced in writing SQL queries and working knowledge of relational databases such as Oracle• Capable of using Python or Shell to automate processes or have a development background• Ability to manage demanding clients' constantly evolving needs• Think quickly and logically under pressure, understand and fix problems in a fast-paced environment• Familiar with the principles of ITIL and can use them to effectively protect and govern our systems• Familiar with newer technologies such as Kafka, Cassandra, Storm and MongoDB• Have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills• Have excellent technical skills and be able to develop new skills quickly• Have a strong background in middleware product support and deployment• Be self-motivated and a good self-starter• Be able to manage own time such that can deliver to project milestones• Willing to work on on-call rotational schedule based on global teams escalations and geographyWhat will you do?It's an incredible time for our industry and specifically the Banking business, the payment revolution continues and will be at the forefront of it. You will be focused on:• Develop and own relationship between Business, Operations, Product and Technology• Provide 24x7 first-line support for mission-critical payment, liquidity, cash, check processing and accounting applications and micro services• Develop specialist knowledge in relevant systems, and share the same with team members and global partners• Liaise with application development, infrastructure and support teams on on-going development, production activity and release management• Pro-actively improve the quality of systems, application and service to increase business value• Collaborate with Project Managers on a variety of project types such as design of app infrastructure architecture and deployment, 3rd Party Controls projects and product upgrades• Manage projects through adhering to project-management best-practices• Bring a DevOps/SRE mind-set to the entire software development life cycle, building, evolving and operating rapidly-changing resilient systems at scale• Define, implement and automate standard product build patterns• Build and deploy new Development, UAT and Production environments• Own all requests including incidents and work closely with other technology teams in order to avoid or minimize business impacts• Coordinated with all stakeholders and perform detailed root cause analysis to avoid repetition of issues• Formulate and implement monitoring strategy across infrastructure and applicationsAbout J.P. Job Title: EXPERIENCE AND QUALIFICATIONS: PREFERRED SKILLS: EDUCATION: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or Engineering, or related field

Overview: operational challenges as an engineer who understands how to test, deploy, and operate software efficiently and effectively. You are someone who is excited to release high quality code that helps the world’s farmers increase their productivity. You will be working on a backend services engineering team. Crafting frameworks and tools that bring a smile to an engineer’s day. Designing, configuring, tuning deployment and validation pipelines, setup test frameworks and tools, while operating the service in production under load and at scale. What You’ll Be Doing: - Deliver effective and reliable validation suites for various service, cluster, lambda, and systems- Create and manage data collateral for use in functional and non-functional validation- Develop and maintain automated processes, tools, and documentation in support of Docker and Kubernetes. - Lead the container best practices in design, development & implementation. - Identify, document, automate an engineer processes for repeated tasks. Tech:● Experience building automation tools in at least one programming language (e.g. Java, Scala, Python, Golang, or Clojure.● Experience with continuous integration systems deploying artifacts into production● Demonstrable knowledge of TCP/IP, HTTP, application security, and multi-tier cloud application architectures. ● Experience with AWS, GCP or similar distributed cloud architectures● Develop, document, and execute deployment test strategies for fault-free releases Additional Qualifications: ● Built and managed a container orchestration platform from the ground up. ● Experience with Docker-based deployment and execution● Experience with artificial dependency tools like LocalStack, WireMock● Solid understanding service access patterns and software quality assurance methodologies● In-depth experience with GitLab’s CI/CD offering. A genuine passion for working with technology to make a real world difference!

Digital Diagnostics is looking for a Principal DevOps Engineer to help shape how applications are deployed, managed, and connected on our new platform. Our flagship product is the artificial intelligence algorithm where it is not the physician, diagnosing patients. Built on a series of patented machine learning algorithms, our FDA cleared software platform detects early signs of diabetic retinopathy, a debilitating eye disease that impacts the 30+ million people with diabetes in the US. We are using everything we’ve learned from IDx-DR to expand our artificial intelligence platform to help patients by detecting diseases like skin cancer. This expansion is critically enabled by our efforts in the healthcare IT space, through EHR integrations, platform connections, and analytics. Now we need to expand our team of highly skilled and motivated team members to help us change healthcare for the better. Working for Digital Diagnostics offers you the opportunity to: Are you someone who: Then apply to be our next Principle DevOps Engineer! Qualifications (aka this is what we will ask about in your interview): This is a permanently remote position. We have engineers across the United States in many different time zones. We to hiring the best engineers no matter where they reside, so location is not factored But if you ever long for of a shared workspace, we have offices in Chicago, Boston and Iowa and would be happy to have you there! Salary Range: $140k-$200K Feeling over or under qualified but still think we’re cool? Have a specialty that doesn’t quite line up with this posting? We are recruiting at a number of levels for all sorts of specialties: Check out our career page at Unfortunately, we are not able to sponsor an immigration case for employment at this time (for example, H-1B or other employment-based immigration cases).

job_offers.job_title: Staff Software Engineer - Pricing at Root Insurance (a $6B valuation startup)
job_offers.description: The engineering team at Root strives to be one of the most transformative engineering teams ever. We’re changing the way that car insurance works. that have been around for a century a $200B industry—and we’re doing it with an astonishingly small team. Our tech stack includes: Ruby / Rails backend, RSpec for testing Javascript / React Native frontend, Mocha for testingSmall amounts of native iOS and Android Deployment to AWS ECS using containers Buildkite for CI We've raised the largest VC round ever for an Ohio and most recently launched our IPO Our team excels at delivering software to build Root’s products: presently, mobile apps and a backend platform for personal auto insurance. We’ve shaped our team and our way of working around this. Our engineering team would not be the most transformative team at building a mobile operating system. We’d be quite bad at that. We’re exceptionally good at building the type of software that is necessary to invoke change in the insurance industry. For more information on engineering at Root see In this role, you would help design and build the next-generation of our pricing data infrastructure. Staff Engineers at Root are our most trusted technical experts and work across multiple teams of engineers to set and coordinate technical direction. Staff Engineers facilitate the delivery of large projects and features by helping design solutions, pair programming with other engineers, contributing to code review, and writing code themselves. They help strengthen the technical prowess of the entire by mentoring and growing the engineers around them. We divide the areas of responsibility for engineers into three major areas: Technical: The skills and knowledge that make up an engineer’s basic problem-solving toolbox. Planning and Execution: The ability to plan and execute assigned work beyond basic technical solutions.Working with Others: The ability to work effectively with other engineers and people in other functions. Scope of Impact Team/Initiative/Company What we look for in Staff Software Engineers: Technical Skills Planning and Execution Working with Others

The Software Engineer Principal is responsible for joining a product team and contributing to the software design, software development, and overall product lifecycle for a product that our users love. The engineering process is highly collaborative. In addition to pairing, Software Engineer Principals field questions from other product teams and encourage cross-team collaboration. They also play an active role working with 3rd party vendors as well as the Software Engineer Principals create foundational code elements that can be reused as well as architectural diagrams and other product-related documentation. They also define service level objectives for products. In addition, Software Engineer Principals may be involved in product configuration, performance tuning and testing as well as production monitoring. As a Software Engineer Principal, you will be an extremely knowledgeable Engineer on the product team and are expected to build and grow the skillsets of the more junior engineers. There is also an expectation that the Software Engineer Principal will demonstrate expertise around modern software design and development. MAJOR TASKS, RESPONSIBILITIES AND KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES 70% – Delivery & Execution 20% – Support & Enablement: 10% – Learning: NATURE AND SCOPE Typically reports to the Software Engineer Manager or Sr. Manager, Technology Director or Sr. Director. ENVIRONMENTAL JOB REQUIREMENTSEnvironment: Located in indoor area. Any unpleasant conditions would be infrequent and not objectionable. Travel: Typically requires overnight travel less than 10% of the time. MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS Must be eighteen years of age or older. Must be legally permitted to work in the United States. Additional Minimum Qualifications: Mastery of an object oriented programming language (preferably Java) Must be legally permitted to work in the United States Education Required: The knowledge, skills and abilities typically acquired through of a bachelor’s degree program or equivalent degree in a field of study related to the job. Years of Relevant Work Experience: 6 years Physical Requirements: Most of the time is spent sitting in position and there is frequent opportunity to move about. job_offers.job_title: Senior Software Architect / Engineer who enjoys coding web services in c#
job_offers.description: 100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US. Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please). What We Do The team at MapLarge builds cutting edge products for data analytics and visualization to make us safer, more productive, and more efficient. The Maplarge API provides real time geospatial analytics for over 15 billion location events per day and trillions of historical events. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly visualize and publish for data discovery and model testing on any desktop, mobile or tablet device. Who We Need Cultural Fit - While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, there are three key traits we require of every team member that really define our team. Skills & Requirements Types of Roles We need talented people to help add cool new features to our platform. Below are the general categories of tasks we are working on, but often people straddle multiple areas so take them more as the general "gist" of what you might do with us. We are looking for smart, hard working, fun people and we will invent the right role to fit them. The key trait we are looking for is people who like to both architect/design and write the code systems. (1) Client Side - Interactive Visuals: We maintain a JavaScript API for for interactive Data Visualization using our high performance web services. We need people both to help add new dynamic animated and other features to the JS API. We also need people to build data driven visuals for our demo gallery if you are artistically or data analysis inclined. Enjoy working with Knockout, Angular, D3.js, HTML5? Check our our galleries to see the kind of stuff you will be working on (2) Full Stack Web Services - Full stack developers who working on both client and server side to produce high performance applications powered by scalable web services are the backbone of our team. We run c# in both .net and mono server side and also maintain a flexible client side API with a large library of We host and run large deployments that sometimes scale to thousands for scientific/industrial/gov users and in a typical day process data over 15 billion records from 110 million streaming data sources. (3) Algorithm / Core Database Development - We built our own in memory database and distributed data analytics pipeline from the ground up with funding from DARPA, and we have a team of really talented researchers working on Pattern analysis, Streaming analytics, Spatial queries and Network graph functions that power our visual engines. We are always looking for practical people who love writing highly optimized code that straddles the line between research and software development. We don't usually publish scientific papers, but we are right out on the edge pulling algorithms out of the latest research papers finding really fast "good enough" approaches that let us tease interesting patterns out of data without getting lost in "science experiment land" Requirements: MapLarge to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MapLarge is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_offers.job_title: Senior Full Stack .Net Web Application Developer
job_offers.description: What We Do The team at MapLarge builds cutting edge products for data analytics and visualization to make the world safer, more productive, and more efficient for our millions of users and thousands of customers. The Maplarge API provides real time geospatial analytics for billions of location events every day. Analysts using our geospatial visualization capability can instantly visualize and publish for data discovery and predictive model testing on any desktop, mobile or tablet device. Who We Need Cultural Fit - While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, there are three key traits we require of every team member that really define our team. About the Role This role is for full stack .Net web developers who enjoy working with WebService API's in C# on the server side and creating sophisticated single page applications in TypeScript and JavaScript on the client side. In this role you will be helping to design and build the server and client side API's for that into new interactive dashboards. This job is for advanced programmers only and you do not have to have any design, css or other artistic skills. Please be ready to tell us about any experience you have working single page applications, designing C# web service API's and building with JavaScript or TypeScript. Requirements: MapLarge to a diverse and inclusive workplace. MapLarge is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, protected veteran status, disability, age, or other legally protected status.

job_offers.job_title: Lead Application Developer / Technical Project Manager
job_offers.description: 100% Remote: This role allows working remotely 100% of the time from anywhere in the US. Workers must be authorized to work in the US (No Non US Applicants Please). Who We Need: We are looking for experienced senior software developers to act as lead application developers helping to design and build applications for customers on top of the MapLarge product suite. Applicants should have a strong history as a lead software developer (no non-technical project managers, please) and should be a top notch C# and JavaScript programmer. We are looking for sophisticated team members who are passionate about not only how UI is used, but also how the APIs, ontology, data structures, documentation, and together to make both the and technical APIs a pleasure for customers to use. Typical Tasks: Typical Tasks include both writing code and leading planning activities. You will often be acting as the lead technical point of contact on customer engagements, running internal and external planning meetings, helping to wireframe user interfaces, creating specs for the public facing APIs that drive them, doing deep dive code reviews with developers, and writing code for key portions of the deployed application. Skills: While we hire all kinds of people and invent roles to fit them, these are the key traits we prefer for this role: MapLarge to a diverse and inclusive workplace.
